it.polimi.group03.domain

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.group03.domain.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the game including players, bars, beads and the board itself. It represents the current status too, such way that some additional info will be stored like lastBarMoved, lastPlayer, nextPlayer, round, turn and so on.

    It will be used by GameEngine and GameValidator.

    Since:
    11/11/2015.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    cecibloom, megireci, tatibloom
    See Also:
    Bar, Player, SlotInfo

        Used to retrieve the last bar moved in the game.

      • lastPlayer

        private Player lastPlayer
        Used to retrieve the player who performed the last move. Possibly read from the UI.

      • losersAfterTurn

        private java.util.List<Player> losersAfterTurn
        Used to retrieve the loser or losers after a move. Possibly read from the UI. This attribute is updated in the refreshBeads(Bar bar) method.

      • movedBarsInCurrentRound

        private java.util.List<Bar> movedBarsInCurrentRound
        List of the bars move in the round. Used when validating the rule of the bars moved by the opponents in the previous round.

      • movedBarsInTwoPreviousRounds

        private java.util.List<Bar> movedBarsInTwoPreviousRounds
        List of the bars move in the two previous rounds. Used when validating the rule of the bars moved in the two consecutive turns by a player when there are only two remaining players in the game.

      • nextPlayer

        private Player nextPlayer
        Used to retrieve the next player in turn. Possibly read from the UI.

      • players

        private java.util.List<Player> players
        List of player playing the current game.

      • round

        private int round
        Used for statistics. This attribute is updated in the makeMove(...) method

      • turn

        private int turn
        Used for statistics. This attribute is updated in the makeMove(...) method

    • Method Detail

      • activePlayers

        public java.util.List<Player> activePlayers()
        This method returns the list of the current active players in the game. A player is consider active if and only if still has beads on the board.
        Returns:
        List of active players (at least 1).
        See Also:
        Player

      • addBarToListOfMovedBarsInRound

        public void addBarToListOfMovedBarsInRound(Bar bar)
        This method adds a bar to the list of bars moved by the opponents in the previous round.
        Parameters:
        bar - current bar

      • addBarToListOfMovedBarsInTwoPreviousRounds

        public void addBarToListOfMovedBarsInTwoPreviousRounds(Bar bar)
        This method adds a bar to the list of bars moved in two previous rounds.
        Parameters:
        bar - current bar

      • addPlayer

        public void addPlayer(Player player)
        This method adds a player to the current list of players in the game.
        Parameters:
        player - to be added to the list.

      • addPlayerToListOfLosersAfterTurn

        private void addPlayerToListOfLosersAfterTurn(Player player)
        This method adds a player to the list of loser after a turn.
        Parameters:
        player - player to be removed from the game

      • configureBar

        private void configureBar(BarOrientation orientation)
        This method sets up the initial composition of every bar in the board. Should be called just once per game. After calling this method a bar will be composed of slots (RED/BLUE when it's cover or BLACK when it's not). The method will configure all bars for the given orientation.

        The method uses the getKeys(int, BarOrientation) method for retrieving the fixed composition of the bars, and the refreshBoard(Bar) method for resetting the values of all slots in the game.

        Parameters:
        orientation - horizontal or vertical
        See Also:
        Bar

      • findBar

        public Bar findBar(int id,
          BarOrientation orientation)
        This method finds a bar inside the Board Game in base of the id and the orientation. Is used to retrieve an specific bar for reviewing the current state of the bar and perform validations and other kind of operations.

        The method uses the getBars(BarOrientation) to retrieve all the bars in the board.

        Parameters:
        id - From 0 to 6
        orientation - vertical or horizontal
        Returns:
        bar corresponding to the given parameters or null if such bar doesn't exist.
        See Also:
        Bar

      • getBars

        public java.util.List<Bar> getBars(BarOrientation orientation)
        This method returns all the bars present in the game for a given orientation.
        Parameters:
        orientation - horizontal or vertical
        Returns:
        bar
        See Also:
        Bar

      • getBoard

        public SlotInfo[][] getBoard()

      • getKeys

        private SlotInfo[] getKeys(int id,
                 BarOrientation orientation)
        This method is in charge of setting the composition of each slot in a bar, this configuration won't change during the game, it will always be the same.
        Parameters:
        id - From 0 to 6
        orientation - horizontal or vertical
        Returns:
        keys for the given bar
        See Also:
        SlotInfo

      • getRound

        public int getRound()

      • getTurn

        public int getTurn()

      • init

        public void init()
        This method will setup the initial state (screenshot) of the game: bars, players, beads and the board itself and some additional attributes that help to have the most accurate info of the board in order to manage the game and some statistics.

        The method uses configureBar(BarOrientation) to set up the composition of the horizontal and vertical bars.

        See Also:
        SlotInfo

      • moveRound

        public void moveRound()
        This method moves the current round of the game to the next i.e adds one to the current value of round.

      • moveTurn

        public void moveTurn()
        This method moves the turn from one user to the next. Does not retrieve the next user in turn, just adds one to the current value of turn.

      • refreshBeads

        public void refreshBeads(Bar bar)
        This method updates the status of all the affected beads once a bar has been moved, based on its coordinates. If the bar moved is vertical, checks only all beads for which the Y coordinate is the same as the id of the bar, and the X coordinate if it's a horizontal bar. The updated status will be INACTIVE for all the beads allocated on a slot in the board which the current value is BLACK or EMPTY.

        After updating the status of all the beads of a player, the status of the player will be updated too in such way that, if the player doesn't have any active bead, the user will be INACTIVE too and it will be added to the list of the looser players.

        The method uses the activePlayers() method to retrieve the current list of active players. The addPlayerToListOfLosersAfterTurn(Player) method to add a player to the list of losers if after the current move the player has lost. Finally uses updateListOfMovedBarsInRound() to remove the first bar in the list of moved bars in the game.

        Parameters:
        bar - in which the last move has been made.
        See Also:
        Bar, Player, Bead, SlotInfo

      • refreshBoard

        public void refreshBoard(Bar bar)
        This method sets new values for each slot in the board (column or row), if it's a horizontal move (RED bars), updates only the value in the slot (to RED or BLACK), if the previous one it's not blue (BLUE covers all the possible colors behind it). If it's a vertical move (BLUE bars) updates the value of the slot, if the previous one it's not RED but if it is RED, does not update it if the current move generates a BLACK slot but yes if generates a BLUE one.
        Parameters:
        bar - Only the slots corresponding to this bar will be updated.
        See Also:
        Bar, SlotInfo

      • resetLosersAfterTurn

        public void resetLosersAfterTurn()
        This method initializes the list of losers after a turn.

      • resetMovedBarsInCurrentRound

        public void resetMovedBarsInCurrentRound()
        This method initializes the list of bars moved by the opponents in the previous round.

      • resetMovedBarsInTwoPreviousRounds

        public void resetMovedBarsInTwoPreviousRounds()
        This method initializes the list of bars moved in two previous rounds.

      • restartTurn

        public void restartTurn()
        This method sets the value of the turn to "1" again. Should be called only when the round has finished.

      • setBoard

        public void setBoard(SlotInfo[][] board)

      • setLastBarMoved

        public void setLastBarMoved(Bar lastBarMoved)

      • setLastPlayer

        public void setLastPlayer(Player lastPlayer)

      • setNextPlayer

        public void setNextPlayer(Player nextPlayer)

      • updateListOfMovedBarsInRound

        private void updateListOfMovedBarsInRound()
        This method removes the first element of the list of moved bars. Should be called whenever a move is made.
